answers.answer: Hi,Your past history of drug use could likely have contributed to your condition.As you have posted, you have started using drugs since you were thirteen.Firstly, I would not suggest that you continue using the viagra until you have your condition assessed by a physician.These medications have their own side effects and increasing or tapering the dose of medications without close supervision of a physician is not encouraged.As with the supplements, I can not say if these are effective in reversing your condition.The underlying cause of your erectile dysfunction has to be ascertained.Reversing the condition means treating the underlying cause directly.Here are some underlying causes of erectile dysfunction:Source:http://www.uroweb.org/fileadmin/user_upload/Guidelines/2005ErectileDysfunction.pdfVasculogenic- Cardiovascular disease- Hypertension- Diabetes mellitus- Hyperlipidaemia- Smoking- Major surgery or radiotherapy (pelvis or retroperitoneum)• Neurogenic- Central causes- Multiple sclerosis- Multiple atrophy- Parkinson’s disease- Tumours- Stroke- Disk disease- Spinal cord disorders- Peripheral causes- Diabetes mellitus- Alcoholism- Uraemia- Polyneuropathy- Surgery (pelvis or retroperitoneum)• Anatomical/structural- Peyronie’s disease- Penile fracture- Congenital curvature of the penis- Micropenis- Hypospadias, epispadias• Hormonal- Hypogonadism- Hyperprolactinemia- Hyper- and hypothyroidism- Cushing’s disease• Drug-induced- Antihypertensives (of all classes, most common by diuretics and beta-blockers)- Antidepressants- Antipsychotics- Antiandrogens- Antihistamines- Recreational drugs (heroin, cocaine, methadone)• Psychogenic- Generalized type (e.g. lack of arousability and disorders of sexual intimacy)- Situational type (e.g. partner-related, performance-related issues or due to distress)At your age and with a strong history of drug use, a thorough assessment is needed to rule out an organic or physical cause first.Psychogenic factors may play a big role in erectile dysfunction.A thorough assessment by a urologist as well as a referral to a counsellor or therapist will guide you through this. Discuss this openly with them, Your past medical history is important.

question: i am 28 years old, i have had problems maintaining an erection since the age of 18.  i have smoked pot since the age of thirteen and have experimented with other drugs as well. In the past year i have quit doing all drugs and alcohol completely and i still am havening trouble maintaining an erection.  viagra is not even working anymore.  im scared that the damage ive done to my body over the years has broken my penis.  i also have masturbated a lot over the years at least 3 times a days since i was younger.  can the damage to my nerves be healed?  is their anything i can do or take to reverse these effects and let my penis heal?  i have recently purchased herbal supplements Viagrowth IV  and vip cream to help  repair my nerves and have stopped masturbating completely, will these help repair damaged nerves in my penis.?  if 100 mg of viagra is not working should i up the dosage?  can viagra use damage the  penis? please any insight would be greatly appreciated.This discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/225646.
title: damaged nerves
